alert.note: Alert for Southwest Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued May 26 at 3:40AM MDT until May 27 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FOR SATURDAY AFTERNOON FOR GILA NATIONAL FOREST AND BLACK RANGE... .Dry, southwest flow will increase along western New Mexico on Saturday as moisture remains confined to the east. Winds will become breezy during the afternoon with 20-foot gusts up to 25 mph. This combined with very low relative humidity will create dangerous fire conditions. Fuel conditions have dried quickly since last week`s rains and are once again susceptible to fire spread. Conditions will improve after sunset when temperatures decrease and winds become light and terrain-driven. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 110... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire weather zone 110, including portions of Grant, Catron, and Sierra Counties in southern New Mexico. * WIND...Southwest at 15 to 25 mph. * HUMIDITY...8 to 14 percent. * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
